intro: Gaertnera morindoides, commonly known as the African starwood, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a small to medium-sized shrub characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often pubescent. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by bright red or orange berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
